unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Experimental $P$-Value
question_text:
An experiment tests the following:
$H_0: \mu = 17$ vs. $H_a: \mu \neq 17$
The standard normal curve is used to find the $p$-value when the test statistic is $z = 1.71$.
What is the $p$-value of the experiment?
solution:
The value in the upper tail to the right of $z = 1.71$ is $1 â€“ 0.9564 = 0.0436$. Since this is a two-sided alternative, you must consider that you were unsure of the experimental result; it could also have occurred in the left tail of the $z$-curve.

Thus, the probability calculated must be doubled in order to report the correct $p$-value:

$0.0436 \cdot 2 = 0.0872$

Therefore, the correct answer is Choice 'B'.
